description: System-wide unique identifier for the customer or user account, often used for login and cross-referencing.
Indicates whether the customer account is currently active and allowed to use fleet services (Y/N).
Customer’s billing or charge account number used for invoicing and cost allocation; confirm specific accounting source with SME.
Default asset category linked to the customer (e.g., vehicle, equipment); likely used for requests or assignments; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the primary asset linked to the customer (vehicle or equipment) for assignments, requests, or billing; confirm usage with SME.
Customer’s full name as displayed on records and communications.
Primary street address line for the customer’s mailing or location information.
Secondary address line (suite, unit, building) for the customer.
City portion of the customer’s address.
State or province for the customer’s address.
Postal/ZIP code for the customer’s address.
Primary telephone number for contacting the customer.
Fax number associated with the customer.
Designated contact person for this account, if different from the customer name; confirm intended use with SME.
Indicates whether the customer is billable or requires separate billing setup; confirm exact business rule with SME.
Billing recipient name to appear on invoices for this customer.
Billing street address used for invoicing.
Billing address city.
Billing address state or province.
Billing address postal/ZIP code.
Sales or usage tax rate applied to taxable charges for this customer, expressed as a percentage or decimal.
Discount rate or amount applied to labor charges for this customer; confirm units with SME.
Discount rate or amount applied to parts charges for this customer; confirm units with SME.
Early payment or prompt-pay discount applicable to invoices; likely a rate or amount; confirm with SME.
Number of days within which prompt payment discount applies.
Number of days after invoice date when full payment is due (net terms).
User-defined field for customer-specific data; configurable; confirm local usage with SME.
User-defined field for additional customer attributes; configurable; confirm local usage with SME.
User-defined field for custom tracking needs; configurable; confirm local usage with SME.
User-defined field reserved for agency-specific data; confirm usage with SME.
User-defined field for miscellaneous customer data; confirm intended content with SME.
User-defined classification or code for the customer; locally configured; confirm semantics with SME.
Primary email address used for notifications and correspondence.
Pager or SMS gateway address used for text-based notifications; legacy field; confirm active use with SME.
Preference flag to send notifications to the customer by email (Y/N).
Defines whether labor charges are taxable for this customer, or specifies a separate labor tax rate; confirm data type with SME.
Defines whether miscellaneous charges are taxable for this customer, or specifies a separate misc tax rate; confirm data type with SME.
Discount rate or amount applied to miscellaneous charges; confirm units with SME.
Free-text notes about the customer, visible to staff for context or special instructions.
User or process that created the customer record.
Date and time when the customer record was created.
User who last updated the customer record.
Date and time of the most recent update to this customer record.
Nearest cross street or intersection related to the customer’s location; used for field service directions.
Organization or company name associated with the customer.
Department or division within the organization associated with the customer.
Identifier linking the customer to stored attachments or documents; used by the attachment subsystem.
System-generated key referencing a standardized address record; likely used for address validation; confirm with SME.
Street number component of the customer address.
Street name component of the customer address.
System login name associated with the customer account; may duplicate or differ from the customer identifier; confirm relationship with SME.
Indicates whether the user is currently banned from accessing the system or services (Y/N).
Date/time until which the ban remains in effect, after which access may be restored.
Reason recorded for banning the user.
Flags the account as an internal staff user rather than an external customer (Y/N).
Mobile phone number for contacting the customer or sending texts.
Secondary telephone number.
Preference flag to send notifications via text/SMS (Y/N).
Preference flag to send notifications to an external email address outside the system’s default routing (Y/N).
Indicates whether the account or email has been verified; numeric or boolean status; confirm domain values with SME.
Date/time when the user last changed their password.
Date when the account expires and access should be disabled.
Flag requiring the user to change password at next login (Y/N).
Previous password hash retained for history and reuse prevention.
Second prior password hash retained for history and reuse prevention.
Third prior password hash retained for history and reuse prevention.
Current password hash (e.g., bcrypt) for authentication; stored securely.
Identifier of the user’s current or last single sign-on session.
Count of consecutive failed login attempts for security and lockout logic.
